PROJET DE FORESTERIE EN COTE D'IVOIRE

abstracts.cdata!:
The project, to be implemented over five
            years, would assist the Government's efforts to start a
            plantation program on a significant scale and would
            strengthen its forestry management and planning capabilities
            through technical assistance to the Unit of Studies and
            Programming within the Ministry of Water and Forests. It
            would consist of a 20,000 ha plantation program as part of a
            68,000 ha program on four estates. It would include clearing
            20,000 ha of logged-over high-forest by force account and
            planting and maintaining short to medium rotation hardwood
            species. Risks of the project stem from its innovative
            nature and its scope. Although the species that would be
            grown have been successfully established over the past
            decade, this would be the first time that they would be
            grown in plantations. This is not expected to raise
            extraordinary difficulties, however, attention would have to
            be given to the technical operations, quality of the timber
            and promotion of the products.
